												Single player is REALLY good but waay too short. Personally I mostly like the multiplayer best, but in the game it's so boring. It's literally the same gameplay over and over again. In general I like the idea and details but there is not much differences between the guns and in lenght the game gets pretty boring as well, because in the campaign there is only 1 specific way to go, so completing it again will not gain you anything else, than your pleasure of shooting and silently murdering people for good, satisfied. As you might see here, I have only played for 8 hrs. It took me 5 hrs to complete the campaign on the hardest difficulty, then I jumped onto the multiplayer section for about 30 minutes until it got boring. I have multiple times started the game up again ever since, but when I played the singleplayer for ~30 minutes I got bored again and closed it. To be honest there was some of the campaign missions where I got stuck, since the checkpoint system made me spawn in a spot where all the enemies could spot me instantly, so the only way to progress was to quick spot all the enemies and start spraying with my pistol or other offhand weapon... Not so much silence and sniper game anymore...On a scale from 1-10 I would rate it about 6.5.It needs something in the content to make it seems like worth the money; it just doesn't right now. My advice to a potential buyer: Only buy it if you save a lot of money, or if it's money that you don't need ;) and ofcourse if you like FPS games, where you are sniping and love the silence kill-streak. I mean, just considering the amount of money for a 5 hrs game.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
												I don't know why I've overlooked the review of this game for so far, but here it goes. This game is good, semi-realistic sniper shooter, FPS-experience with awsome graphics and without any major flaws. It is very pleasant and enjoyable game that has extremely low learning curve (even on hardest difficulty) offering something new to the usual FPS-games. I don't want to say that it gives totally new perspectives since there are many good snipers shooters out there already, sniper elite for one. It requires a gamer which veers of from mainstream games. It isn't fast paced or loaded with xp and leveling systems that unlock new shitey after few kills.The combat mechanic is pretty basic and keyboard mapping is simple and easy to use. This makes the gameplay very solid and control of your character is responsive and the game doesn't feel sluqqish. Although sometimes I think devs lost a part of their imagination and this game got trambled by major FPS-shooters. Most of the maps are actually simple "hallway"-runs consisting of boring tasks: " get to point A to B ". Additional points for doing this undetected. In small doses that is ok. The game has nice, actually "posible" stealth elements, not like in cod in which you can sneak pass of platoon of infantry and tanks in ghillie-suit without being noticed whilst communicating with your partner (which I think was ridiciolous). In the hardest difficuly you will get spotted very easily. I would like to think that is realistic, and when that happens you are in really bad situation. But you are given a choice, you can go stealth or you can go guns blazin'. The sniping experience itself is done nicely and is semi-realistic. Wind and gravity affecting bullet trajectory are nice touches that you don't see in todays FPS-games. Mostly the circumstances are one or two clicks left or right and  two and a half clic down. This is when the game loses some of its reality and leaves room for improvement. There could have been more variety to this. I do remember one mission high in some Nepal-mountains and my first thought was that the wind is going to be faster, but no. Same as in the city streets and other various environments. The "spotter" in objective in easier difficulties makes it easy for new players to be introduced to this game. The single player campaing is decent with basic storyline. Graphics are intense and I think they are a real land-mark to gaming but have gone unnoticed unfortunately. The multiplayer is another story. If you get to a server which is free of hackers, glitchers or passers you can enjoy the MP. It totally changes expectations of MP, no running and jumping aimlessly, ammo conservation etc. No stupid, overkill killstreak rewards or unlocks of new guns. There are plenty of guns to choose from. I think that every guns has its specs even though they are not listed in any way. Scopes vary in style and maginification, mil-dot and others. Weapons ROF varies from semi-automatic to single shot rifles. Calibres from .50 to smaller and I think this has an effect to a bullet penetration at least in some form. Matches vary in length. I have played many 2+ hour matches and then again many 30 min matches. Both as fun as it gets. Hardcore mode is a cherry on top of everything. If you manage to get into a clean hardcore game it is pure fun. Every shot counts and you really need to count for bullet drop and winds. It is too bad that even this game is ruined with hackers and cheaters. Granted, this game especially the MP asks for nerves and patience which most of the players don't have. I don't think that kids like this game since it doesn't flash and make sounds every 5 seconds and give you xp or leves every two minutes.In all this is a good game that has a lot of potential. It doesn't suffer from any major flaws and it was not released as broken as many games do today. Few parts are repetitive and some things seem to come in circles, but I don't see this as minus since EVERY game today has a LOT of repetition already. This game isn't any different. If this game makes to a sale, buy it. It also has few DLCs that give few extra hours of gameplay, but they are not essential in anyway. The main game is easy to jump in and you can easily pick up from where you left of even after longer period of time. If you are into mp but have short attention span then this game isn't for you. It really requires thought and patience. TL;DR: Good, underestimated game with great graphics. SP consits of 6-24 hours of gameplay and if the starts ar aligned correctly a great MP. But if you are into mainstream shooters, think twice. I want to say that this game isn't for 80% of today's gamers but that is just my two cents.

Posted: February 6, 2014
												I bought this game primarily for the single player, with multiplayer being secondary.The single player was interesting, giving you a variety of options for dealing with a varying number of enemies in different scenarios.  Whether it be the sniper bullet blowing up a hand grenade on an enemy's belt, or just a good ol' fashioned melee from behind, you have to choose not only your manner of killing, but the timing, very carefully.  After playing through most of the campaign once on Normal, I can definitely see the replay value for this game on hard, or just for fun on easy.Multiplayer wise I only needed a few matches to see what this game is.  Sniping, camping, and painfully slow-paced.  It's a sniper game where you only get snipers essentially... if you've played enough CoD or Battlefield, you know exactly what that means.All in all, if you want this game for the campaign/single player content, definitely worth a few playthroughs.  If you're looking for an obscure multiplayer FPS for some reason.... keep looking.  Fortunately, I bought this for the former of those two, and was not disappointed.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2013
												The game looks, plays, and feels like Call of Duty, except the only weapon you get to use is a sniper rifle. There are several different kinds of sniper rifles (MSR, M24, M82A1, etc.), but the only other weapon you have to use is a suppressed pistol, firing which feels like shooting a BB gun. The voice acting is horribly bad, and I do mean BAD. The game is almost played for you unless you are playing on the hardest difficulty. Everything is spelled out for you almost exactly, including where to go, who to kill and in what order, and where every last enemy is. On that note, enemies are lifeless. You might as well be shooting at mannequins. They will randomly spew out different phrases in Russian(?), from, I believe, a pool of set quotes. This being an FPS I'm not too surprised. The game also 'borrows' tricks and gimmicks from Call of Duty 4 rather frequently... I won't give any spoilers though.Despite all this, environments are verdant and, though linear, well-designed as far as visuals go. The sniper aspect is, though somewhat inaccurate, challenging enough; firing a shot at the wrong time will have several automatic rifles firing in your direction, a bit pulse-pounding, but this is easily avoided, because, even though bullets can fly straight through enemies and hit a piece of metal behind them, resulting in a loud 'pang' sound, this will still not alert them. In fact I'm sure the only way to get detected is to stand in their direct line of sight, and even then it takes a few seconds for them to notice you. It's also apparent that you are playing as a perfectly weightless man, because you cannot hear your footsteps at all - I'm serious, they are completely silent. Because of this, you can sprint up behing an enemy and stab him with no difficulty at all.Definitely one of my less enjoyed shooters, but at least the sniping is a bit (and I do mean a VERY SMALL BIT) more realistic than Call of Duty.

Posted: October 7, 2015
												   Well, if they ever make a 3rd one, this one will at least give me incentive to play it. The sequel to the horrible first sniper ghost warrior game, Sniper 2 is in fact a much better incarnation.   As a sniper, the action was very good. You are refularly forced to sit down, look at the area, and plan your shots and kills, something the first one didn't give you as much (in so far as I played into it anyways). There is some action here and there to keep things interesting, including a few forced alerts you have to deal with which helps break the monotony of sneaking and sniping. Story and graphics were good, though the story itself was nothing special, but did keep things interesting overall.   As for complaints, not really much. As a sniping game, it set out what it intended to do very well, much better then the first game. My only complaint would be maybe the adding an assault level or two to keep things more interesting (assuming the assault rifles can be fired without jumping around like a kid with a mother of a sugar rush). However, that's a small thing, and doesn't really detract from the game itself.   Overall, I would definetely recommend this game. Though perhaps not on par with sniper elite, it is still a good sniping game, and one worth definetely trying (unlike its predecessor which you should avoid with a 10-foot pole).

Posted: December 22, 2014
												First of all, CI games did many weird things these years. They own CryEngine and develop Ghost Warrior 2 with it. But they switched to UE 3 to develop Alien Rage, and when they cooperated with Deck 13, all of sudden, they had an in-house engine to develop Lords of the Fallen. I still cannot figure out why they don't have consistency in development cycles. Aside from that, here is my review.1. Graphics looks terrible. It is not about DX9 or the CryEngine. I don't know, but it looks bad.2. sound effects are pretty good I have to admit, and the voice acting is good as well.3. Too many bugs and glitches. Sometimes, bugs happened just before the checkpoint, when that happens, every time you reload to last checkpoint, the bugs will take effects making it unplayable and you can only start the entire level again.4. Gameplay is ok, using sniper rifle is fun. But this is not a good sniper or stealth game. 5. There must be something wrong with this game. It really feels like playing COD. The level intro looks like MW 1&2.I know this is a military game, but Splinter Cell Blacklist has the level intro which feels different, and BF's level intro is different either. In conclusion, this game is not bad but not good, just average to play, maybe you can find something you like in this game, and when it is on sale, maybe a good purchase. 5.5/10

												Single player is REALLY good but waay too short. Personally I mostly like the multiplayer best, but in the game it's so boring. It's literally the same gameplay over and over again. In general I like the idea and details but there is not much differences between the guns and in lenght the game gets pretty boring as well, because in the campaign there is only 1 specific way to go, so completing it again will not gain you anything else, than your pleasure of shooting and silently murdering people for good, satisfied. As you might see here, I have only played for 8 hrs. It took me 5 hrs to complete the campaign on the hardest difficulty, then I jumped onto the multiplayer section for about 30 minutes until it got boring. I have multiple times started the game up again ever since, but when I played the singleplayer for ~30 minutes I got bored again and closed it. To be honest there was some of the campaign missions where I got stuck, since the checkpoint system made me spawn in a spot where all the enemies could spot me instantly, so the only way to progress was to quick spot all the enemies and start spraying with my pistol or other offhand weapon... Not so much silence and sniper game anymore...On a scale from 1-10 I would rate it about 6.5.It needs something in the content to make it seems like worth the money; it just doesn't right now. My advice to a potential buyer: Only buy it if you save a lot of money, or if it's money that you don't need ;) and ofcourse if you like FPS games, where you are sniping and love the silence kill-streak. I mean, just considering the amount of money for a 5 hrs game.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												First of all, CI games did many weird things these years. They own CryEngine and develop Ghost Warrior 2 with it. But they switched to UE 3 to develop Alien Rage, and when they cooperated with Deck 13, all of sudden, they had an in-house engine to develop Lords of the Fallen. I still cannot figure out why they don't have consistency in development cycles. Aside from that, here is my review.1. Graphics looks terrible. It is not about DX9 or the CryEngine. I don't know, but it looks bad.2. sound effects are pretty good I have to admit, and the voice acting is good as well.3. Too many bugs and glitches. Sometimes, bugs happened just before the checkpoint, when that happens, every time you reload to last checkpoint, the bugs will take effects making it unplayable and you can only start the entire level again.4. Gameplay is ok, using sniper rifle is fun. But this is not a good sniper or stealth game. 5. There must be something wrong with this game. It really feels like playing COD. The level intro looks like MW 1&2.I know this is a military game, but Splinter Cell Blacklist has the level intro which feels different, and BF's level intro is different either. In conclusion, this game is not bad but not good, just average to play, maybe you can find something you like in this game, and when it is on sale, maybe a good purchase. 5.5/10

content:
Posted: March 29
												I had fun but it has some problems. I beat the game and the DLC on hard in 5-6 hours. There's some replayability to get acheivements or pick up all the secrets but if that's not your thing then you'll be done with it quickly. I would definitely play it on hard even if it's your first time. It isn't very diffiicult in the first place and the lower difficulties make the game trivial (the game gives you a lead indicator dot).Most levels are extremely linear and you'll constantly have to follow your spotter or follow directions around in the main game. There are a lot of scripted events and if you deviate from exactly where the game wants you to go you'll die. The DLC missions are far better when it comes to freedom since you're solo the entire time. You'll have some options in movement in the larger areas but most of the time it works to just start sniping as soon as you enter them rather than sneaking by or changing position. At times it feels like you're just going from one target range to the next as your traverse a level. The story is cliche and bad but the voice acting is mostly pretty good.The game really shines when you make it to "over watch" positions. When you're there you feel like a sniper and can survey large and detailed areas. A lot of fun can be had doing things stealthily and shooting enemies when they aren't in sight of their friends or by shooting their grenades and taking out a group with one shot. The rifles feel powerful and are fun to shoot. Enemies die in one hit to the chest or head and it's always satisfying making a tough shot.Only buy it when it's on sale.

Posted: October 29, 2013
												Sequel to the worst sniping game I've ever played. There's more sniping in this game, practically the whole game is sniping only and it's still not so great, it's progress compared to the last game. Crytek allowed CI to use CryEngine 3, and it's still even worse looking than the original Crysis -- and Crysis used CryEngine 2 -- and quite honestly, the rest of the game -- while better than the original title -- is bad. The only plus side is that it has Troy Baker and his talent cannot save this game. It's just all around awful, unless you somehow enjoyed Sniper: Ghost Warrior, I recommend steering clear of this one, if you enjoyed the first game, go ahead and play this, by all means.+ Great sniping mechanics+ Good soundtrack+ Excellent voice-acting+ Bullet cam+ Kinda pretty+ Better story than the first Ghost Warrior- Sometimes stealth breaks way too easily- AI often feels dumb, despite seeing you incredibly easily- Glitchy physics- Bullet cam is kinda boring, with Sniper Elite as a competitor- Crashing- Awful multiplayer- Awful port

content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
												Basically a decent arcade shooter with a strong console feel to it. Visually, it's quite decent, the audio is fairly immersive although the weapon sounds are so-so.The missions are extremely linear but well designed, alternating stealth and action.Compared to the "big" titles of the same genre like COD, the difference mostly shows in the way the player character is managed. Here you never feel like you have a choice. It's basically a number of different levels to beat as they were designed to be beaten. Stray from the path and you'll get killed. Games with a larger budget like COD manage to hide this fact much more effectively. Supposedly you can shoot enemies behind cover but in practice you can't (most military bullets will pass through wood, not in this game). Except for glass.All in all a decent entry in a fairly crowded genre.

												Pierwszy Sniper: Ghost Warrior okazał się - mimo często krytycznych recenzji - całkiem sporym hitem na rynku gier. Przyzwoita jakość, niska cena i rzadko wykorzystywana tematyka sprawiły, że wielu graczy skusiło się na zakup. Nie powinno więc dziwić, że CI Games (dawniej City Interactive) poszło za ciosem, dość szybko zapowiadając kontynuację.Tym razem jednak firma postanowiła na dobre pozbyć się odium "producenta gier z kiosku" i zainwestowała w Sniper: Ghost Warrior 2 znacznie więcej środków. Najlepszym przykładem była choćby decyzja o zakupieniu nowoczesnego silnika CryEngine 3. Czy udało się w ten sposób nowemu Snajperowi wśliznąć niepostrzeżenie do segmentu AAA? Otóż nie bardzo.Sniper: Ghost Warrior 2 opowiada nam przez pięc do siedmiu godzin burzliwą i dramatyczną historię kapitana Cole'a Andersona, związaną z nielegalnym handlem bronią i terroryzmem. Większość akcji umieszczona została w czasach współczesnych, nie brakuje jednak modnych ostatnio retrospekcji, czyli powrotów do przeszłych wydarzeń. Całość jednego z trzech aktów pozwoli nam spojrzeć na historię Andersona z perspektywy czasu.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												It's an okay sniper/stealth game mimicking Sniper Elite, but not nearly as immense content-wise/story-wise. It's hardly comparable though since both take place in different times, Ghost Warrior being modern-era type Iraq War Sniper. Sniper Elite being the lucrative and precedented WW2-Era sniper. Ghost Warrior campaign is pretty short, even at highest difficulty (took me something like 6 hours). Playing Higher difficulty just means you end up dying a lot in some areas because they force you into some close combat situations where you may be fighting 3-5 guys at once. It's mainly a strafe shooter at those points where if you're not handy with quick movements and simultaneous shooting than you will most likely never get past (on the highest difficulty might I re-iterate).It does offer a good look at to how snipers act, how spotting works (some of the time, not the whole campaign), and the intensity of some missions that probably closely relate to real life sorties and immerses you into their world for a few hours. I'd recommend it for cheap (I bought it at 29.99, it's now 3.99).

 Overview Worst MP ever - just a bunch of people who camp the same spot over & over again where they can see everything, but you can only barely/can't see them. I love how people can shoot + see through that 1 sandbag into people. it's also literally only snipers & that's boring, and map designs are terrible[what a shocker]. Why would you ever only create only 1 pathway to the enemy? Cons - Bad MP- Only Snipers/Pistols despite team-members using XM8s- Why are you saving during mission briefing? It causes an un-natural pause.- Enemies see you far too well. I can understand how soldiers on a perch can see you from up top, but from below? What's the point of a ghillie suit if they can see you through the locale weeds?- Some parts cannot be done stealthily- Cannot pickup enemy weapons- What's the point of medkits if you naturally restore 80% of your hp even on the highest difficulty? Siberia Expansion Time total: 2hrs 40 minutes - multiple failures | attempted & successful stealth run.there are 3 chapters and approximately 3 parts to each chapter.There are 3 areas where it's impossible not to shoot: The beginning, overwatching Diaz & final part.My advice for the Sniper on the tanker that is approximately 1km away is to not overshoot it & don't rely on your markings.If you're going for stealth always take out the high snipers/overwatching & any soldiers directly in your way can be stealthily knifed.I was hitting the 1km sniper @ 6/7th Horizontal[supposedly 700m] | 2-3 Vertical w/ 3-5M W Wind.I excitely await Ghost Warrior 3

												Only played the first mission so far. It's very much like the previous in the series. However because the game uses CryEngine 3 this time you can choose to play in any one of three 3D modes. It's nice to finally get a chance to play a game in 3D, although because it strains the eyes somewhat I will probably only play every other mission in 3D. I'm playing on a nVidia GTX 1060 and I get no FPS lag with highest settings, and no crashes so far. I got the game discounted, so if you like linear sniper games, then go for it. 6/10 for the game, 7/10 if you can play it in 3D.

Posted: November 21, 2015
												First of all. CRYENGINE 3 delivers! Well, most of the time. Sometimes it's hard to understand why I see details "popup" when I play on highest possible settings...Let's cut to the game. The story is not bad, has couple of twists, and most of the time it's really enjoyable.However, I have to warn you about couple things:- Checkpoints ... Sometimes they force you to replay large chunks of a level.- If you are not following the script the game will most likely get bugged. Enemies will not move. Your partners will stuck etc.- I know the goal of a sniping game is to stay undetected and eliminate your opposition from a cover, but from time to time (some times it's your fault, some times it's just the way the script works) enemies will get aware of your presence, and then EVERY FREAKING TIME they know exactly where you are, and will gang up on you completely ignoring your partner, D'oh...- Yes, your partner... Sometimes he is just useless, he shoots around ignoring enemies that shoot at you, gets stuck or even runs outside of mission area. Not funny!- Too many time It feels like an "on rails" shooter with invisible walls, and action zones that you can't leave... Really sad :(These problems are not always there, but when they happen, they most likley happen all at once :P and you will probably get frustrated. Other than that it was fun, and I have to recommend it. You can grab it for peanuts on a sale and it's a bargain for 7-8h of play. +1 if you can play it in 2160p60 on highest settings ;)
